definition: the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: The countries would share the cost of the move.
sentences.chinese: 美日两国将分担迁址的费用。

sentences.english: Obama and Kan are expected to reaffirm the importance of the U.S.-Japan alliance.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马和菅直人预计将重申美日同盟的重要性。

sentences.english: Picture: A US-Japan joint military exercise in December 2010. (File Photo/CFP)
sentences.chinese: 上图为2010年12月美日联合军事演习画面。

sentences.english: The second chapter is about the historical review of the US-Japanese Alliance.
sentences.chinese: 第二章叙述美日同盟的历史回顾。

sentences.english: Joint US Japan, counterattack against the mainland, save one billion three hundred million people.
sentences.chinese: 联合美日，反攻大陆，解救十三亿中国人。

sentences.english: Burns also cited the global nature of the U.S.-Japan alliance.
sentences.chinese: 伯恩斯还谈到美日同盟关系的全球意义。

sentences.english: The US military base in Japan is an issue between the US and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 驻日美军基地是美日两国之间的问题。

sentences.english: All of these formed an extreme stress to Chinese security. The fifth chapter is about the prospect of Chinese security strategies.
sentences.chinese: 第四章论述了美日同盟对中国安全带来的影响。

sentences.english: Hence, strategically, India can let US/Japan to confront China in SCS.
sentences.chinese: 因此，战略上，让美日对抗中国印度坐收渔利。

definition: (coll.) an American/person from the United States
